title: david678345
author: david678345
content: Are there any promotions for spot trading without fees currently?I think sometimes there are promotions that offer spot trading without commissions for the btc usdt pair or eth usdt pair

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: I know Bybit and Binance had a promotion not a long time ago, you can double check but I believe they both ended. So you've only got MEXC left and it's applicable to all trading pairs:Quote from: https://support.mexc.com/hc/en-001/articles/17101730313113--MEXC-Mega-Offer-Zero-Fee-Spot-Trading-Start time: 16:00, April 1, 2023 (UTC)End time: Until further noticeApplicable pairs: All spot trading pairs on MEXC

comments.author: disconnectme
comments.body: People need to be careful about free things, I still trust Binance better than other exchanges, I remember when MEXC did their own free trading if you look at their order book you will understand that the spread is where they take their own fee from you If it is free, you are the fees. If you trade in size and you trade on Binance there is  a tie for you and but if you are a retail trader why worry about trading fees because it is low and won't impact your portfolio

comments.author: death69
comments.body: Oh, snap! Free trades on your wish list? I feel ya, buddy, I feel ya. But let's face the facts—we're talking trading, not a philanthropic escapade. comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: The only reason why they had spot free trading is because they made most of their money with their perp and futures trading. Those had crazy volumes and they made a small amount off the spot trading. So an exchange like Binance can do this.Other exchanges like Coinbase or Gemini obviously can’t because they need the revenue from fees to survive. Also remember the fees might be free but there is still a spread and depending on the liquidity it might have a large spread between the bid and ask.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: david678345 on April 23, 2023, 02:52:34 PMAre there any promotions for spot trading without fees currently?I think sometimes there are promotions that offer spot trading without commissions for the btc usdt pair or eth usdt pairI am not sure about other exchanges, but on Binance such promotions occur every once in a while. In fact most times Binance gives vouchers to its users that they can apply so they can trade some pairs without any trading fees. Sometimes those promotions allows each and every user of the exchange to trade without fees. In those times there isn't a need to apply any promo code at all.I personally find such promotions as a way to attract more traders to their platform, but still that's a really good initiative taken by Binance as that helps current users a lot. I would definitely recommend you to go with Binance if you want such promotions as well a better trading experience. Their exchange is currently the top one in cryptocurrency market, and so far my experience has been amazing with them.

But, why we should look at untrusted exchanges when there is someone who can offer it in the first place?

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: Anything that is free, will never stay for forever. And from what I know. Trading fee is very low on many reputable platforms. So the best thing is to give the fee that they want. Or move on to other platform which is as reliable as the previous one. But when you are comfortable with one, and you are unable to find a new legit one or having some trust issue. It is better to stick to the one you are familiar with and pay the fee that they want. Because you don't wanna lose all your assets just because you refuse to pay a very small amount of fee.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: CarnagexD on April 24, 2023, 03:34:36 PMBinance do have. If you trade using BUSD, there will be no commission cost or trading fee on every transaction for your trades.When Binance started in 2017, it used to offer free trading across and it used to perplex me why any business would run on zero trading fees when it's not an NGO or charitable organization. My perplexity gave way to anxiety and worry as I soon began to imagine if Binance wouldn't disappear with investors (my) cash. Howbeit, it was a strategy to get traffic to its site as we can see years later. However, if I were OP I wouldn't worry so much about trading fees as I would worry about the safety of my funds. Safety comes first for me. I don't like the idea of "penny wise, pound foolish."
